website_summaries.verdict: With head-turning looks, long battery life, and innovative port placement, the HP Spectre x360 13 is an excellent 2-in-1 convertible laptop.
pros: Corner-mounted power button and USB port
cons: Bottom of laptop gets very warm

customer_reviews.title: Faulty and unstable
customer_reviews.text: The laptop itself looks great, and feels well made. However from here it's all downhill. I had issues with both my original order and replacement in which the laptop crashed repeatedly. I tried resetting the laptop and reinstalling all of the associated software. But alas this didn't resolve the issue. All in all too unstable for me to use in the end.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Conrad

customer_reviews.title: Had a faulty product.
customer_reviews.text: Upon searching online for my issue it seemed common enough considering it's price tag. A lead had already disconnected internally rendering the camera useless. It felt solid and nice but without a dedicated video card (which I was willing to go without) and then an issue that doesn't seem that rare, I can't see myself recommending this laptop. Shame as it looked and felt great (although it did get very hot when charging). I'm the end I got the refund and purchased a different laptop of similar size and features and I feel much better about my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Howlle

customer_reviews.title: Return first purchase, second purchase works brill.
customer_reviews.text: First time I bought this, I had to return it. The trackpad stopped working and the touch screen wasn't very responsive. I got a replacement and I can now write a positive review. It's definitely a brilliant laptop that's worth the money. I just wish that there was an option so that only the pen that's in the box works with the touch screen and not your fingers as it's really easy to accidentally press something you're not meant to. All in all, I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Beast, worth value | HP spectre 360 is best in class.
customer_reviews.text: Just got this laptop last week and one word that defines it is Innovation or two words, beautiful beast. I agree all said that it makes little noise from the vent due to fan but ignorable. Worth value as touch screen with pen and best design that attracts you to write, as I am an author. I’ll post my pros and cons after checking all features sooner but this machine is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Vikrmn Author

customer_reviews.title: Excellent screen quality
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this laptop. The battery is terrible and it's quite noisy, but this is normal among laptops with this level of performance. It's light weighted, stylish and durable. Screen quality is fantastic. Another downside is the lack of USB ports. Only one is just not enough. But I already had a hub so this wasn' a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worth the extra cost!
customer_reviews.text: Didn't like the price but it's fast stylish and better value and performance than the nearest Microsoft or Apple alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Easy, sleek and fast.
customer_reviews.text: Fast, sleek and easy. Pity that it takes only micro sdcards! Would have been great if it took normal SD cards. Got accessory for this but could have come with this for such a higher price!
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: Expensive and not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: very stylish but not worth the money. Too late I am discovering many faults. Charging lead gets very very hot. Mouse touchpad not accurate. Microphone faulty.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful machine
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for a Sony Viao of about fifteen years old. I have been told that it works brilliantly on all fronts

customer_reviews.title: Poor support from HP
customer_reviews.text: I like this laptop but the usb(c) port is not working. Tried to contact HP support as virtual agent cannot hack it, but failed. Probably because of lockdown. Think only remedy is to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Kennuk

customer_reviews.title: Excellent laptop
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product. This is what I was looking for .large capacity and fast computer . It is too early to comment other details.
customer_reviews.author: Rahul Ranjan

customer_reviews.title: Good Labtop, horribe track pad
customer_reviews.text: The laptop is great. I track pad is awful though. Ok if your using an bluetooth or wired mouse.

customer_reviews.title: Near flawless
customer_reviews.text: It does everything that was advertised. An outstanding lap top and the most impressive I have owned.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Journeaux

customer_reviews.title: WiFi keeps cutting off
customer_reviews.text: The wifi keeps cutting off.. this is the only device which does that in my home... asides from this looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Fums

customer_reviews.title: Good one
customer_reviews.text: Everything except battery is good. They could improve the battery
customer_reviews.author: Naga Bonagiri

customer_reviews.title: Problem with display
customer_reviews.text: I have bought a 13 in with 1980x1280 scree. There are few issues with display. There is excessive red hue which I had to then manually adjust in the settings. One would have thought that appropriate calibration would have been done at factory. The brightness of the monitor changes with the angle of view which is rather annoying as you have to constantly adjust the angle as you read through the page. I have access to other laptops and never experienced this issue before. I am not sure whether my unit is faulty as the reviews are totally different.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, and not as expensive as alternatives!
customer_reviews.text: I've now been using a Spectre 13 x360 13-ap0001na for 3 months. Incredibly happy with it. Might seem expensive, but look at the alternatives and it isn’t. Typically by high end laptops (still use a Dell Precision workstation, a £3,000 fully spec'd beast). But wanted something lighter, fast, stylish, with a great screen, battery life. The Spectre 13 x360 ticks the boxes. Tilt pen is better than most too (and it came included, not another £100+ like some)
customer_reviews.author: Neil Walker

customer_reviews.title: Lots of people with bricked Spectre’s
customer_reviews.text: Mine has turned in to a brick after 10 months very light use. This is clearly an issue many people have had with this machine if you look at the forums and support groups online. It is a nice looking bit of kit, high spec and was working well. However I would definitely recommended forking out for extra warranties, and take more disk back ups than you normally would if you purchase this item.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Woodbridge

customer_reviews.title: Display
customer_reviews.text: Mine came with a faulty display, glitches of pixels when I change from desktop mode to tablet mode....disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ionel Croitoriu
